title: quarantinesim
text: quarantinesim R package bundles final, cleaned dataset quarantine outbreak scenarios Shiny app explore scenarios interactively. row dataset represents one epidemiological scenario defined : basic reproduction number (R0), vaccine effectiveness (VE), vaccination coverage, corresponding modelled outbreak probabilities travellers quarantine workers. vignette shows : load dataset shipped package, quick data exploration, make simple visualisation, launch Shiny app.

title: quarantinesim
text: working inside assignment project, install package locally: load :

title: quarantinesim
text: main dataset included package called data_quarantine. key variables : R0 : basic reproduction number VE : vaccine effectiveness (0–1) coverage : vaccination coverage proportion (0–1) traveller_ob_prob : outbreak probability travellers worker_ob_prob : outbreak probability quarantine workers chance50, chance95 : time/iteration outbreak probability reaches 50% / 95% dataset already merged cleaned package creation, need join separate traveller/worker tables timing summaries.

title: quarantinesim
text: common task compare outbreak probabilities across different R0 values fixed vaccine effectiveness (VE). pick VE == 0.5 plot traveller worker probabilities, coloured coverage.  plot can see : higher R0 leads higher outbreak probability, higher coverage shifts curve downward, traveller worker probabilities can behave differently, plotting informative.
code: data_quarantine |> dplyr::filter(VE == 0.5) |> ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(x = R0)) + ggplot2::geom_line( ggplot2::aes(y = traveller_ob_prob, colour = factor(coverage)) ) + ggplot2::geom_line( ggplot2::aes(y = worker_ob_prob, colour = factor(coverage)), linetype = "dashed" ) + ggplot2::labs( title = "Outbreak probability by R0 (VE = 0.5)", subtitle = "solid = travellers, dashed = workers", y = "Outbreak probability", colour = "Coverage" ) + ggplot2::theme_minimal()

title: quarantinesim
text: package also includes Shiny app located inst/app/. can launch using exported helper: keep eval = FALSE vignette can built non-interactively. interactive R session, app open can: Select vaccine coverage using slider, Traveller outbreak probability Worker outbreak probability Time 50% outbreak Time 95% outbreak Line (default) Points Bars grouped VE Plot tab visualises chosen outcome varies R₀ increases, colours facets representing different vaccine effectiveness (VE). Data tab displays underlying filtered dataset corresponding selected coverage, allowing inspect exact outbreak probabilities timing values used generate plots. plot, short explanatory panel helps interpret patterns: Higher R₀ values generally correspond higher outbreak probabilities, higher vaccine coverage shifts curves downward—reducing likelihood outbreaks.

title: quarantinesim
text: can extend quarantinesim : Adding visualisations (e.g., faceting VE), Creating helper functions filter_by_ve(), Enhancing Shiny interface (adding tabs download buttons), Including additional simulated scenarios data-raw/ re-running usethis::use_data(). vignette created Monash University ETC5532 / Communicating Data assignment demonstrate package documentation Shiny integration.

what: Simulation and Analysis of Quarantine Outbreak Risk
title: Simulation and Analysis of Quarantine Outbreak Risk
text: quarantinesim provides ready--use dataset quarantine outbreak scenarios can explored R built-Shiny app. dataset already merged cleaned, row represents simulated epidemiological scenario defined : R0 : basic reproduction number VE : vaccine effectiveness coverage : vaccination coverage proportion also includes modelled outputs : traveller_ob_prob: outbreak probability travellers worker_ob_prob: outbreak probability quarantine workers chance50: time iteration outbreak probability reaches 50% chance95: time iteration outbreak probability reaches 95% package designed exploratory data analysis visualisation, includes Shiny app allows users interactively explore outbreak risk changes coverage, R0, VE, switch different outcomes (probabilities time--outbreak).

title: Simulation and Analysis of Quarantine Outbreak Risk
text: can install development version quarantinesim GitHub : , working locally inside package project: load package: app lets : select vaccine coverage, choose outcome display (traveller, worker, chance50, chance95), switch chart type (line, point, bar), also viewing filtered data separate tab.
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("ETC5523-2025/assignment-4-packages-and-shiny-apps-Melisa-ops") install.packages("devtools")  # if not installed yet  devtools::install() library(quarantinesim)

title: Simulation and Analysis of Quarantine Outbreak Risk
code: library(quarantinesim)  # load dataset shipped with the package data("data_quarantine")  # see sample of data head(data_quarantine) #>          key R0  VE coverage traveller_ob_prob worker_ob_prob chance50 #> 1  5_0.5_0.1  5 0.5      0.1           0.00903        0.14613 46.27000 #> 2  6_0.5_0.1  6 0.5      0.1           0.01352        0.16433 29.48333 #> 3  7_0.5_0.1  7 0.5      0.1           0.01370        0.17484 25.76167 #> 4  8_0.5_0.1  8 0.5      0.1           0.01881        0.18244 20.28667 #> 5  9_0.5_0.1  9 0.5      0.1           0.02028        0.19702 15.72000 #> 6 10_0.5_0.1 10 0.5      0.1           0.02102        0.20334 15.06333 #>    chance95 #> 1 198.82600 #> 2 128.46667 #> 3 108.34800 #> 4  87.98933 #> 5  68.72667 #> 6  64.61433  # outbreak probability by R0 for VE =0.5 data_quarantine |>   dplyr::filter(VE == 0.5) |>   ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(x = R0)) +   ggplot2::geom_line(ggplot2::aes(y = traveller_ob_prob, colour = factor(coverage))) +   ggplot2::geom_line(     ggplot2::aes(y = worker_ob_prob, colour = factor(coverage)),     linetype = "dashed"   ) +   ggplot2::labs(     y = "Outbreak probability",     colour = "Vaccine coverage",     title = "Outbreak probability by R0 (VE = 0.5)",     subtitle = "solid = travellers, dashed = workers"   ) +   ggplot2::theme_minimal()

title: Simulation and Analysis of Quarantine Outbreak Risk

title: Simulation and Analysis of Quarantine Outbreak Risk
text: data_quarantine : final dataset containing merged outbreak scenarios run_quarantinesim() : launches interactive Shiny app Shiny app inst/app/ : UI explore outbreak probabilities across R0, VE, coverage Package documentation : created roxygen2 data functions

title: Quarantine outbreak simulation dataset — data_quarantine
text: dataset contains simulated epidemiological scenarios representing potential quarantine outbreak conditions based varying transmission vaccination parameters. row represents single simulation scenario defined combinations R0 (basic reproduction number), vaccine effectiveness (VE), vaccination coverage.

title: Quarantine outbreak simulation dataset — data_quarantine
text: Simulated data prepared Monash University ETC5532 assignment   R package development Shiny application (2025).

title: Quarantine outbreak simulation dataset — data_quarantine
text: Variables include: - `key`: Unique identifier combining R0, VE, coverage values - `R0`: Basic reproduction number representing disease transmissibility - `VE`: Vaccine effectiveness (0–1) - `coverage`: Proportion population vaccinated (0–1) - `traveller_ob_prob`: Probability outbreak initiated traveller - `worker_ob_prob`: Probability outbreak initiated quarantine worker - `chance50`: Iteration outbreak probability reaches 50 - `chance95`: Iteration outbreak probability reaches 95

what: Run the quarantinesim Shiny application — run_quarantinesim
title: Run the quarantinesim Shiny application — run_quarantinesim
text: function launches quarantinesim Shiny app, lets users explore outbreak probabilities R0, vaccine effectiveness (VE), vaccination coverage.
